poem:
Escalations

In the shadow of the mountain,  
two nations,  
locked in a dance of fire,  
hurling distances—  
missiles through sky,  
each whispering  
a name, a place  
to unremember.  
Land of rivers, of borders,  
no line divides  
grief from grief,  
or memory  
from the flicker  
just before dawn.
